item.description:
This is a dog friendly 4 1/2 mile loop around beautiful Tully Lake. Parking is at the Tully lake Recreation Area on Royalston Road (rt 32), not at the Tully Dam further south on rt 32 or Lake Campground which is on Doane's Road. Folks have gotten them confused in the past.Tully Lake Recreation Area is a great place to picnic as well if anyone would like to take the time to enjoy the picnic grounds after our hike. Not planning a gathering though this time.

Anyone wishing to paddle around the Lake or Long Pond is also welcome. Rental kayaks and canoes are available at Tully Campground(on Doane's Road) but must get there early and campers have first dibs on them.


http://www.northquabbinwoods.org/entries/168


Description:

Tully Lake Recreation Area protects about four miles of the Tully River, including Long Pond, where the river widens, and the 200-acre Tully Lake, created by a flood-control dam. The wetlands and the forest support a wide variety of flora and fauna, lists of which are available online. The land and the lake offer numerous recreational opportunities, including camping, picnicking, boating, fishing, and hiking. A one-mile interpretive trail introduces visitors to both natural and cultural history; another trail loops around the lake and connects to scenic vistas and waterfalls. Part of this loop constitutes one leg of the Tully Trail.


Directions:

From Rte. 2 take Exit 17 (Rte. 32N) and follow Rte 32 signs closely for about 6 miles to entrance, just past dam, on right.

There is no fee for parking.

PLEASE Note: The Map and address above are for the park office which is just south of the Tully Dam. The Lake Recreational Area is just north of the Tully Dam.

 

Please also note: This hike is mostly easy terrain with some small ups and downs but has a gradual ascend to reach Doane's Falls.
item.how_to_find_us: I drive a maroon Monte Carlo.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Last Minute Loop Hike Around Tully lake, 4 1/2 miles
